Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sulk \Sulk\, n. [L. sulcus.] A furrow. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sulk \Sulk\, v. i. [See {Sulkiness}.] To be silently sullen; to be morose or obstinate. --T. Hook. [1913 Webster]

sulk n : a mood or display of sullen aloofness or withdrawal; "stayed home in a sulk" [syn: {sulkiness}] v : be in a huff and display one's displeasure; "She is pouting because she didn't get what she wanted" [syn: {pout}, {brood}]
